perturbation.original_text: 3.5 Books and Records. As applicable under the Omnibus Reconciliation Act of 1980, until the expiration of four (4) years after the furnishing of Services pursuant to this Agreement, the Company will, upon receipt of written request, and if then requested to make such information available under the then-existing Law, make available to the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, the Comptroller General of the U.S. Department of Secretary of Health and Human Services, or any of their fully-authorized representatives, the books, documents, and/or records of the Company that are necessary to verify the nature and extent of costs associated therewith.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.5 Books and Records. As applicable under the Omnibus Reconciliation Act of 1980, until the expiration of one (1) year after the furnishing of Services pursuant to this Agreement, the Company will, upon receipt of written request, and if then requested to make such information available under the then-existing Law, make available to the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, the Comptroller General of the U.S. Department of Secretary of Health and Human Services, or any of their fully-authorized representatives, the books, documents, and/or records of the Company that are necessary to verify the nature and extent of costs associated therewith.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the company to maintain records for four years, complying with federal regulations under the Omnibus Reconciliation Act. The modified text reduces this period to one year, creating non-compliance with federal regulatory standards requiring longer retention periods for healthcare-related financial records.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Order Process. In order to activate Merchant Processing Services for a Merchant Processing Services Customer, the proposed Merchant Processing Services Customer must submit (directly or indirectly through Allscripts) a completed Merchant Application and executed Merchant Agreement to the Company within [***] from the execution by such Merchant Processing Services Customer of a Customer Agreement. Within [***] of the modification or termination (other than sublicenses that expire at the end of a term previously specified in a Purchase Order) of any Customer Agreement, Allscripts will provide the Company with written notice of such modification or termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Order Process. In order to activate Merchant Processing Services for a Merchant Processing Services Customer, the proposed Merchant Processing Services Customer must submit (directly or indirectly through Allscripts) a completed Merchant Application and executed Merchant Agreement to the Company within 1 day from the execution by such Merchant Processing Services Customer of a Customer Agreement. Within 90 days of the modification or termination (other than sublicenses that expire at the end of a term previously specified in a Purchase Order) of any Customer Agreement, Allscripts will provide the Company with written notice of such modification or termination.
perturbation.explanation: By shortening the application submission timeframe to 1 day, the contract now creates a legal contradiction and potential non-compliance with consumer protection and fair business practices, which require a reasonable time for customers to review and understand contracts and service agreements. Also, the notification period of 90 days after the customer agreement has been modified or terminated is too long. It may cause potential harm to the clients, where it takes more time to inform about the modifications or termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws, Fair Business Practices

perturbation.original_text: 14.4 Non-Solicitation. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of [***] thereafter, neither Party nor its controlled Affiliates will, without the prior written consent of the other Party, directly or indirectly solicit for employment any then-current employee of the other Party or its controlled Affiliates; [***].
perturbation.changed_text: 14.4 Non-Solicitation. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of 10 years thereafter, neither Party nor its controlled Affiliates will, without the prior written consent of the other Party, directly or indirectly solicit for employment any then-current employee of the other Party or its controlled Affiliates; [***].
perturbation.explanation: The modified text extends the non-solicitation period to 10 years. This creates a potential legal issue as overly broad non-solicitation agreements can be deemed unenforceable restraints on trade, violating state laws designed to protect employee mobility and competition. The reasonableness of a non-solicitation clause depends on factors like duration and geographic scope. A 10-year restriction is likely to be challenged as unreasonably long in many jurisdictions, especially without specific justification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Laws on Restraint of Trade/Employee Mobility
